bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 217 (Sunday, December 20, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. GABBARD:H.R. 9037.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:U.S. Consitution including Article I, Section 8, Clause 1(General Welfare Clause) and Article 1, Section 8, Clause 18(Necessary and Proper Clause), Article 4, Section 3, Clause 2(Property)[Page H7284]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

item.name: Department of Health and Human Services

summary.text:
National Healthcare Acquired Infection and Medical Error Transparency Act

This bill establishes a program to collect confidential reports from health care providers that detail instances of health care-acquired infections and medical errors.

It also establishes the Office of Patient Safety and Health Care Quality within the Department of Health and Human Services to administer the program.

bill.title: National Healthcare Acquired Infection and Medical Error Transparency Act

item.title: National Healthcare Acquired Infection and Medical Error Transparency Act
National Healthcare Acquired Infection and Medical Error Transparency Act
To amend the Public Health Service Act to ensure transparency within the health care system through the establishment of a National Healthcare Acquired Infection and Medical Error Reporting Program.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
